history.content: You'll likely be able to take CS 162 in a later semester if you phase 1 it, as many students drop the class. I'd highly recommend NOT trying to do 162 with an internship over summer. CS 162 is a very heavy class, even in a regular semster you'd consistently be putting in 20-30hrs a week. Summer is double speed since you only have half the amount of time, so if you're doing CS 162 over summer I'd plan to not do anything else.

children.subject: The new department rules is that CS Minors will be given a list of preapproved CS upper divs they can take each semester. Due to the popularity of 162 and the (at least by Berkeley standards) small class size, I personally doubt CS Minors will be given the option to take the class at all. In short I would not count on being able to take it as of now.

Makes sense that Phase 1'ing the class will enable someone to take the class. However, I just confirmed with Cindy yesterday in one of the follow-up threads that DS-majors will not be allowed to enroll/waitlist in CS 162 entirely. 

CS Minors won't be allowed to do so for at least this Fall semester. So if I wanted to take it over a semester, I'd be hoping that CS Minors will be put into that pool. Is this something I can rely on?

history.content:
This summer I have a ~20 hrs/week internship, and was thinking about taking CS 162 over the summer as well.

As a 2nd-year data science major, it's unlikely we'll be allowed to enroll in CS 162. And I'm not sure if CS Minors (which I am) will also be able to enroll, and would rather not hedge my bets on that. I'd like to keep SWE as a viable career path for myself which is why I'm trying to hard to take 162. 

Given the recent updates regarding upper divs, this summer seems to be the only chance I'll get to ever take 162, as next summer I'll (hopefully) have a full time internship, and really don't wanna tackle 162. This summer is also looking quite bad lol but I was wondering if anyone had any advice / thoughts on how I can make it not as bad? Or if the CS minor population might be allowed into 162 (in which case I'll gladly take it in a senior-year semester)? 

Thanks!
